provisions.content: (1) There is established by this Act a body corporate with perpetual succession to be known as the Ghana Tourism Authority. provisions.title: Object of the Authority
provisions.content: The object of the Authority is to promote the sustainable development of the tourism industry internationally and within the country. The object of the Authority is to promote the sustainable development of the tourism industry internationally and within the country.

(6) The Panel shall hear, review and deliberate on an appeal in accordance with this Act and rules of procedure set out in Regulations made under this Act. The Panel shall hear, review and deliberate on an appeal in accordance with this Act and rules of procedure set out in Regulations made under this Act. (7) A member of the Board or an officer of the Authority shall not be a member of the Panel. A member of the Board or an officer of the Authority shall not be a member of the Panel. (8) The Panel shall regulate the procedure for its meetings. The Panel shall regulate the procedure for its meetings. (9) A person dissatisfied with a decision of the Panel may institute an action in a court. A person dissatisfied with a decision of the Panel may institute an action in a court. (10) The Minister shall prescribe the allowances to be paid to members of the Panel in consultation with the Minister for Finance. The Minister shall prescribe the allowances to be paid to members of the Panel in consultation with the Minister for Finance.

provisions.title: Appeals against acts of the Authority
provisions.content: (1) A person who is aggrieved by A person who is aggrieved by the refusal of the Authority to grant or modify a licence; the refusal of the Authority to grant or modify a licence; any condition attached to a licence; any condition attached to a licence; the modification, suspension or cancellation of a licence; or the modification, suspension or cancellation of a licence; or any other decision of the Authority may, within fourteen days after the notification has been received of the act complained of, appeal in writing to the Panel. any other decision of the Authority may, within fourteen days after the notification has been received of the act complained of, appeal in writing to the Panel. (2) Where the Authority has suspended, modified or cancelled a licence, the suspension, modification or cancellation shall not take effect until the end of the time within which an appeal may be made to the Panel or, if an appeal has been made, until the appeal has been determined, except where the closure has been in the public interest. Where the Authority has suspended, modified or cancelled a licence, the suspension, modification or cancellation shall not take effect until the end of the time within which an appeal may be made to the Panel or, if an appeal has been made, until the appeal has been determined, except where the closure has been in the public interest.

provisions.title: Register to be kept by tourist accommodation licensees
provisions.content: (1) A holder of a tourist accommodation licence shall keep a register on the premises and shall enter in the register the name and address of each guest who stays in the accommodation and other particulars that the Authority may prescribe. A holder of a tourist accommodation licence shall keep a register on the premises and shall enter in the register the name and address of each guest who stays in the accommodation and other particulars that the Authority may prescribe. (2) The register shall be retained by the holder of the tourist accommodation licence for at least five years. The register shall be retained by the holder of the tourist accommodation licence for at least five years. (3) Each guest shall be provided with a registration card which shall be completed by the guest and submitted by the licensee to the Authority as demanded in writing. Each guest shall be provided with a registration card which shall be completed by the guest and submitted by the licensee to the Authority as demanded in writing. (4) A person who A person who fails to comply with this section, or fails to comply with this section, or makes or permits to be made in any register or book kept under this section, an entry which the person knows or has reason to believe is false makes or permits to be made in any register or book kept under this section, an entry which the person knows or has reason to believe is false commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than one hundred penalty units or to imprisonment for a term of not more than six months or to both.

provisions.title: Liability to guests
provisions.content: A holder of a tourism enterprise licence is not liable to make good to a guest any loss of, or damage to property brought to the licensee's premises by the guest unless at the time the loss or damage occurred, the guest had sleeping accommodation at the premises, the notice referred to in section 37 was in place and the property was stolen, lost or damaged through the default, neglect or wilful act of the licensee or a person in the employment of the licensee; or the property was stolen, lost or damaged through the default, neglect or wilful act of the licensee or a person in the employment of the licensee; or the property was deposited by or on behalf of the guest expressly for safe custody with the licensee or a person in the licensee's employment authorised or who appeared to be authorised for the purpose. the property was deposited by or on behalf of the guest expressly for safe custody with the licensee or a person in the licensee's employment authorised or who appeared to be authorised for the purpose.

provisions.title: Notice on premises of tourism enterprises in respect of property of guest
provisions.content: A holder of a tourism enterprise licence shall display a notice on the premises of the tourism enterprise relating to property brought to the premises by a guest in the form that may be prescribed. A holder of a tourism enterprise licence shall display a notice on the premises of the tourism enterprise relating to property brought to the premises by a guest in the form that may be prescribed.

provisions.title: Right of sale
provisions.content: (1) The holder of a tourism enterprise licence has the right to confiscate and may sell property deposited or left with the licensee or on the premises of the licensee where the guest is indebted to the licensee for non-payment of accommodation, food or services used or consumed by the guest except that the sale shall not be made until the expiration of three months after the date the debt accrued and remains unpaid. The holder of a tourism enterprise licence has the right to confiscate and may sell property deposited or left with the licensee or on the premises of the licensee where the guest is indebted to the licensee for non-payment of accommodation, food or services used or consumed by the guest except that the sale shall not be made until the expiration of three months after the date the debt accrued and remains unpaid. (2) The licensee shall retain an amount sufficient to cover the debt and expenses incurred in respect of the sale and shall pay to the guest on demand any surplus money. The licensee shall retain an amount sufficient to cover the debt and expenses incurred in respect of the sale and shall pay to the guest on demand any surplus money. (3) Lost and found items on the premises of the licensee may be sold by the licensee after three months' notice is given to the guest in accordance with the particulars given by the guest in the register. Lost and found items on the premises of the licensee may be sold by the licensee after three months' notice is given to the guest in accordance with the particulars given by the guest in the register.

provisions.title: Appointment of inspectors
provisions.content: (1) The Authority shall appoint inspectors for the effective implementation of its functions under this Act The Authority shall appoint inspectors for the effective implementation of its functions under this Act (2) An inspector shall be issued with a certificate of appointment by the Authority. An inspector shall be issued with a certificate of appointment by the Authority. (3) An inspector shall, in the discharge of the inspector's duties, produce the certificate whenever required by the manager or other person responsible for a tourism enterprise under this Act. An inspector shall, in the discharge of the inspector's duties, produce the certificate whenever required by the manager or other person responsible for a tourism enterprise under this Act.

provisions.title: Powers of inspectors
provisions.content: (1) An inspector may An inspector may monitor on-going projects of physical structures of tourism enterprises before the grant of a licence for the tourism enterprise; monitor on-going projects of physical structures of tourism enterprises before the grant of a licence for the tourism enterprise; enter, inspect and examine a tourism enterprise during working hours, by day or by night; enter, inspect and examine a tourism enterprise during working hours, by day or by night; take along a police officer in the discharge of the duties under paragraph (a) if the inspector has reasonable cause to expect obstruction in the execution of the inspector's duty; take along a police officer in the discharge of the duties under paragraph (a) if the inspector has reasonable cause to expect obstruction in the execution of the inspector's duty; require the production of any register, licence or document kept in pursuance of this Act and to inspect, examine and copy any of the documents; require the production of any register, licence or document kept in pursuance of this Act and to inspect, examine and copy any of the documents; make or cause to be made any examination and enquiry necessary to ascertain whether the provisions of this Act and enactments in force related to public health are being complied with by a tourism enterprise and any employees of the enterprise; make or cause to be made any examination and enquiry necessary to ascertain whether the provisions of this Act and enactments in force related to public health are being complied with by a tourism enterprise and any employees of the enterprise; require a person who the inspector finds in a tourism enterprise to give information as to who is the operator of the enterprise if it is in that persons power to give the information; and require a person who the inspector finds in a tourism enterprise to give information as to who is the operator of the enterprise if it is in that persons power to give the information; and inspect premises with inspectors from other agencies which may include Food and Drugs Administration, Ghana National Fire Service and Environmental Protection Agency. inspect premises with inspectors from other agencies which may include Food and Drugs Administration, Ghana National Fire Service and Environmental Protection Agency. (2) The operator, agent or staff of the operator of a tourism enterprise, shall facilitate the requirements of an inspector necessary for an entry, inspection, examination, enquiry, the taking of samples, or otherwise for the exercise of the powers of the inspector under this Act in relation to that enterprise. The operator, agent or staff of the operator of a tourism enterprise, shall facilitate the requirements of an inspector necessary for an entry, inspection, examination, enquiry, the taking of samples, or otherwise for the exercise of the powers of the inspector under this Act in relation to that enterprise.

provisions.title: Obstruction of inspectors
provisions.content: (1) A person who obstructs an inspector in the performance of a function under this Act commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than one hundred and fifty penalty units or to a term of imprisonment of not more than twelve months or to both. A person who obstructs an inspector in the performance of a function under this Act commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than one hundred and fifty penalty units or to a term of imprisonment of not more than twelve months or to both. (2) A person who is in charge of a tourism enterprise for the time being and who A person who is in charge of a tourism enterprise for the time being and who wilfully delays an inspector in the performance of the inspector's functions, wilfully delays an inspector in the performance of the inspector's functions, fails to produce any register, licence or document which the person is required to produce under this Act, or fails to produce any register, licence or document which the person is required to produce under this Act, or withholds any information concerning the enterprise, withholds any information concerning the enterprise, is considered to have obstructed an inspector in the performance of the inspector's functions under this Act.

provisions.title: Public Private Partnership Forum
provisions.content: (1) There shall be a Public Private Partnership Forum to encourage public private partnerships to promote tourism development opportunities. There shall be a Public Private Partnership Forum to encourage public private partnerships to promote tourism development opportunities. (2) The Forum shall be organised by the Ministry in collaboration with the Authority and the Private Sector. The Forum shall be organised by the Ministry in collaboration with the Authority and the Private Sector. (3) The Forum shall be used by the Ministry to interact with the private sector on matters concerned with the tourism industry. The Forum shall be used by the Ministry to interact with the private sector on matters concerned with the tourism industry. (4) The Forum shall establish committees to deal with specific issues. The Forum shall establish committees to deal with specific issues. (5) The Forum shall meet at least once each quarter at a place and time to be determined by the Minister. The Forum shall meet at least once each quarter at a place and time to be determined by the Minister.

provisions.title: Settlement by alternative dispute resolution
provisions.content: In accordance with the Alternative Dispute Resolution Act, 2010 (Act 798), tourism enterprises may agree to use alternative dispute resolution methods for the resolution of conflict between them. In accordance with the Alternative Dispute Resolution Act, 2010 (Act 798), tourism enterprises may agree to use alternative dispute resolution methods for the resolution of conflict between them.

provisions.title: Advertisements and promotions
provisions.content: (1) An advertisement or promotion in respect of tourism information by any person shall be certified by the Authority. An advertisement or promotion in respect of tourism information by any person shall be certified by the Authority. (2) An advertisement or promotion in respect of tourism information shall not be made which has the effect or is likely to have the effect of An advertisement or promotion in respect of tourism information shall not be made which has the effect or is likely to have the effect of misleading consumers or withholding from them adequate information as to their rights and obligations under a consumer transaction, misleading consumers or withholding from them adequate information as to their rights and obligations under a consumer transaction, otherwise misleading or confusing consumers as regards any matter related to a consumer transaction, or otherwise misleading or confusing consumers as regards any matter related to a consumer transaction, or corrupting public morals. corrupting public morals. (3) A person who contravenes this section commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of two hundred and fifty penalty units or a term of imprisonment of two years or to both. A person who contravenes this section commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of two hundred and fifty penalty units or a term of imprisonment of two years or to both. (4) The Authority in collaboration with other public agencies, may in addition, direct a person responsible for the dissemination of the advertisement to withdraw or modify it. The Authority in collaboration with other public agencies, may in addition, direct a person responsible for the dissemination of the advertisement to withdraw or modify it.

provisions.title: Designation of tourist sites
provisions.content: (1) The Minister, on the advice of the Authority, may by Regulations designate a location which is predominantly visited by tourists or has potential as a tourist site and set standards for the tourist site. The Minister, on the advice of the Authority, may by Regulations designate a location which is predominantly visited by tourists or has potential as a tourist site and set standards for the tourist site. (2) Where a location has been designated as a tourist site, the Minister may consult with the appropriate body for the control, conduct or prohibition of activities at the location. Where a location has been designated as a tourist site, the Minister may consult with the appropriate body for the control, conduct or prohibition of activities at the location. (3) Where the location to be designated as a tourist site is Where the location to be designated as a tourist site is under the administrative control of another Ministry, department, agency or other body, or under the administrative control of another Ministry, department, agency or other body, or private property private property the Minister shall, in consultation with the relevant institution and property owner designate the site as a tourist site.

provisions.title: Export of trophy
provisions.content: A tourist shall not export a trophy from the country except in accordance with the Wild Animals Preservation Act, 1961 (Act 43). A tourist shall not export a trophy from the country except in accordance with the Wild Animals Preservation Act, 1961 (Act 43).

provisions.title: Antiquities
provisions.content: A tourist shall only deal with antiquity in accordance with the National Museum Act, 1969 (N.L.C.D. 387). A tourist shall only deal with antiquity in accordance with the National Museum Act, 1969 (N.L.C.D. 387).

provisions.content: (1) The Minister may on the recommendations of the Board by legislative instrument make Regulations The Minister may on the recommendations of the Board by legislative instrument make Regulations to amend the Schedule to this Act; (2) A person who commits an offence under the Regulations is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than five thousand penalty units. (3) The Minister responsible for Finance shall prescribe fees to be paid under this Act. The Minister responsible for Finance shall prescribe fees to be paid under this Act.

provisions.title: Dissolution of existing Board and vesting of assets in Authority
provisions.content: (1) The Ghana Tourist Board in existence at the commencement of this Act is hereby dissolved. The Ghana Tourist Board in existence at the commencement of this Act is hereby dissolved. (2) The assets, rights, property, obligations, liabilities and staff of the Board established under the Ghana Tourist Board Act 1973 (N.R.C.D. 224) as amended by S.M.C.D. 80 and in existence immediately before the coming into force of this Act shall be transferred to the Authority. The assets, rights, property, obligations, liabilities and staff of the Board established under the Ghana Tourist Board Act 1973 (N.R.C.D. 224) as amended by S.M.C.D. 80 and in existence immediately before the coming into force of this Act shall be transferred to the Authority.

provisions.title: Repeal, saving and transitional provisions
provisions.content: (1) The following enactments are hereby repealed The following enactments are hereby repealed Hotel Proprietors Act, 1957 (No. 20); and Hotel Proprietors Act, 1957 (No. 20); and Ghana Tourist Control Authority Act, 1973 (N.R.C.D. 224). Ghana Tourist Control Authority Act, 1973 (N.R.C.D. 224). (2) Despite the repeal of the enactments specified in subsection (1), any Regulations, bye-laws, notices, orders, directions, appointments or other acts lawfully made or done under the repealed enactments and in force immediately before the commencement of this Act shall continue to have effect as if made under this Act with the necessary modification until amended, revoked, cancelled, withdrawn or terminated under this Act. Despite the repeal of the enactments specified in subsection (1), any Regulations, bye-laws, notices, orders, directions, appointments or other acts lawfully made or done under the repealed enactments and in force immediately before the commencement of this Act shall continue to have effect as if made under this Act with the necessary modification until amended, revoked, cancelled, withdrawn or terminated under this Act. (3) The Civil Aviation (Air Transport Licensing) Regulations, 1976 (L.I.1075) shall apply with the necessary modification to flights on behalf of tourists or closed groups. The Civil Aviation (Air Transport Licensing) Regulations, 1976 (L.I.1075) shall apply with the necessary modification to flights on behalf of tourists or closed groups. (4) On the commencement of this Act, a person who holds a licence issued under the repealed enactment and who desires to operate under this Act shall within six months after the commencement of this Act apply to the Authority for a licence under this Act. On the commencement of this Act, a person who holds a licence issued under the repealed enactment and who desires to operate under this Act shall within six months after the commencement of this Act apply to the Authority for a licence under this Act.
